column6: The IPCC's Chief Executive is the IPCC's Accounting Officer and is accountable to the Home Office Principal Accounting Officer and to Parliament. She is responsible for running the organisation which supports the work of the Commission.
column9: Chief Executive's Private Office and Commission Secretariat

column5: Acting Director Of Finance and IT
column6: The  Acting Director of Finance and IT is responsible for running the directorate which provides Finance, IT and Security to the organisation.

column5: Acting Director of HR, Procurement and Estates
column6: The Acting Director of HR and Estates is responsible for running the directorate which provides  Human Resources, Procurement and Estates.

column5: Director Of Casework and Customer Services
column6: The Director of Casework and Customer Services is responsible for the staff who make decisions on appeals made by members of the public and the Customer Contact Centre.
The Acting Director of Standards and Quality is responsible for the directorate which leads on standards, quality assurance, risk management, operational training and performance data.
The Director of Investigations is responsible for the directorate which investigates the most serious complaints and allegations of misconduct against the police in England and Wales.
The Director of Hillsborough is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the IPCC's  into the Hillsborough disaster
The Director of Change is responsible for the directorate  planning for the proposed expansion of the IPCC
